source_sentence: 由此或應許苦法智不能頓斷三結隨界。
translation: From this, it might be possible that knowledge of the truth of suffering doesn't immediately cut the three bonds and the accompanying sphere.

source_sentence: 或復應許苦法智時頓斷一切見所斷結。
translation: Perhaps it's also permissible to suddenly end all the bonds that are cut by views when you have knowledge of the truth of suffering.

source_sentence: 如是則應於後後位觀餘聖諦功並唐捐。
translation: In that case, he should examine the merits of the other noble truths at a later stage and abandon them.
Since this is the case, he shouldn't allow gradual manifestation to be contemplated.
Furthermore, he should examine the doctrine of the meaning established in the preceding seat.
It seems to suggest that the stream-winner hasn't seen the truths yet.
The superior seat makes this claim on its own.
'When the noble path of the lowest class arises,' he said.
momentum is able to wash away continuity.
It causes the three bonds to be instantly cut off in accordance with the [three] realms.
The stage of birth of the noble path must be in the future.
However, that's a teaching that won't exist in the future.

source_sentence: 若聖道未有能浣濯相續。
translation: If the noble path hasn't yet been able to rinse continuity.
It would cause the three bonds to be instantly cut off in accordance with the [three] realms.
Doesn't it mean that they haven't yet seen the stage of the truth?
The three bonds that follow the elements are no longer present in their bodies.
They then become pre-current and have not yet seen the truth.
If that's what they mean, then when the noble path arises.
There are still supplementary realms in the continuum.
How can it be said that when the noble path arises.
momentum can already wash away continuity.
The three bonds and ensuing constituents still reside in his body.
They then say that they've been able to cleanse continuity.
Such an intention is extremely difficult to understand.
What else does it mean to say is that the noble path is being produced ...
At that point, the three bonds and accompanying constituents are ceasing.
Nor should it be said that when the noble path is being born.
momentum has been able to rinse away continuity.
Whatever is said to be correctly ceasing must be now.
It's because the noble path exists when it's born, following the elements.

source_sentence: 又彼設謂隨界滅時不能為因牽後隨界。
translation: It's also assumed that when the following realm ceases, it can't be the cause that pulls in the following realm.
That's what they mean when they say it's been cleansed.
It shouldn't be said to have been rinsed.
It's only to be said that it's correctly washed.
Furthermore, what's been explained before becomes a stream-enterer.
It's always difficult to avoid a fallacy that's not yet seen as a truth.

source_sentence: 彼於一諦理見仍未滿故。
translation: It's because their view of the principle of the single truth is still not complete.

source_sentence: 於一二三諦見未圓滿時。
translation: When their views of the one, two, and three truths are not yet perfected.
they can still be called seeing the truths that are not yet seen.
Only when there's a full view of the truths is it called a stream-enterer.

source_sentence: 以經說預流見諦圓滿故。
translation: It's because the sūtras say that pre-current views are perfected in regard to the truths.
How could it be that he still sees one truth that's not yet perfected?
Yet, it can be called attaining stream-winner.
Suppose the holy path is called birth in the present.
At that point, it's been able to wash away continuity.
Then, the old followers of the realm are stopped by forbearance.
At that point, knowledge arises when its essence is no longer present.
That's a contradiction with their own thesis.
Furthermore, they admit that forbearance isn't part of the noble path.
How could it cut the three bonds and the ensuing realms?
The present world is called having arisen.
When it's described as having arisen, it shouldn't be the correct principle.
Therefore, the doctrine of meaning established by the superior seat.
'The principle may not allow gradual manifestation of contemplation.'
Perhaps it's definitely permissible when one sees the truth of the path.
Only then can he permanently end the three bonds without remainder.
This is consistent with the doctrine that I'm right in regard to the teaching.
They shouldn't claim to have established a separate doctrinal goal.

source_sentence: 說一切有部順正理論卷第六十二
translation: Shuoqie youbu shunzheng lun, vol. 62
